DataElement.preferredName: Additional Malignancy Therapy Post Transplantation Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether additional malignancy-directed therapy was administered after bone marrow transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Additional Malignancy Therapy Post Transplantation Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR Primary Immunosuppression CRF template.10.21.2016.dmr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
